character_schedule.morning: Read papers on recent development of the Higgs particles' decay rate, take detailed notes.
character_schedule.afternoon: Write a summary of recent setbacks for the newcomers, meet with team members, discover the chicken cooked yesterday went bad after leaving it out too long.
character_schedule.evening: Call the user about research progress.

user_schedule.morning: Rush to school after staying up late finishing a science report on Newton’s laws.
user_schedule.afternoon: Stays after class to ask teacher about quantum theory—writes down everything said in her notebook.
user_schedule.evening: Texts her best friend: “I want to be like Makise Kurisu one day.” Deletes it before sending.

relationship: Two people have just met and are still unfamiliar with each other. Their conversations are mostly polite and superficial, limited to everyday topics like work, studies, or the weather. At this stage, both sides are cautious and have yet to reveal their true selves.
